definition: to crash (of a computer)/Taiwanese term for 當機|当机[dang4 ji1]

sentences.english: This means that unplanned and unannounced server outages will happen.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着一定会出现计划外的服务器宕机。

sentences.english: And hackers, downtime, and errors happen all the time.
sentences.chinese: 还有骇客，宕机和其他错误老是发生。

sentences.english: Webmonkey: So do you suffer the same service outages as the general public?
sentences.chinese: 那你们也和公众用户一样受宕机之困？

sentences.english: Hence achieving a high availability and avoiding any downtimes.
sentences.chinese: 这样就实现高可用性，避免了任何宕机。

sentences.english: Many of the most popular sites on the Internet were affected by S3′s downtime.
sentences.chinese: 许多最流行的网站都受到了S3宕机的影响。

sentences.english: In the worst case, this can result in cluster outages.
sentences.chinese: 对于最坏的情况，这将导致集群宕机。

sentences.english: These capabilities make it easier to respond to a variety of outages.
sentences.chinese: 这些功能使其能够更容易地响应各种宕机情况。

sentences.english: Outages are particularly painful for users of mobile devices.
sentences.chinese: 断电宕机对于移动设备用户来说特别糟糕。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, maintenance can be performed on the master node to analyze why it went down.
sentences.chinese: 同时，可以对主节点进行维护，分析它为什么会宕机。

sentences.english: What irked many about the downtime was the lack of communication from the development team.
sentences.chinese: 使宕机带来麻烦的是开发团队缺乏沟通。

definition: to crash (of a computer)/to stop working/(loanword from English "down")
distributed denial of service (DDOS) form of Internet attack
pinyin: fen1 bu4 shi4 ju4 jue2 fu2 wu4
